author: alexsharp12
content: Ok, I finally got to listen to that call on the 28th of April. And <@425274498732916736>  did say something quite interesting at the end - that not a single minute was spent on discussing the core part of the EOF, which may be showing that it is pretty transparent to the applications, as designed. Also, I realised that Danno's article written on the 25th of April was not shown: https://notes.ethereum.org/@ipsilon/eof-ethereums-gateway-to-risc-v. <@273808422753796097>  linked it in today's "simple" post. However, it is not clear from the post whether the author (vitalik) agrees or disagrees with Danno that the transition from EVM to RISCV would require the "core" of EOF (what Pawel mentioned), or something with a different name.

author: sendmoodz
content: there's no reason to think you'd need to ship EOF to implement the EVM in RISCV, if anything it would just make it harder (or make the program larger, if the work is already done)
